edge: Baywatch movie was first announced in 2004, although the movie became stuck in development hell over the years, with several writers penning drafts.
In July 2015, Sean Anders was replaced by Seth Gordon as director.
Justin Malen was set to rewrite the script.
Beau Flynn and Ivan Reitman joined to produce with Johnson's Seven Bucks Productions.
Seven actresses were among the short list testing for the lead female role, Alexandra Daddario,
Seven actresses were among the short list testing for the lead female role, Ashley Benson,
Seven actresses were among the short list testing for the lead female role, Nina Dobrev,
Seven actresses were among the short list testing for the lead female role, Alexandra Shipp,
Seven actresses were among the short list testing for the lead female role, Shelley Hennig,
Seven actresses were among the short list testing for the lead female role, Bianca A. Santos,
Seven actresses were among the short list testing for the lead female role, Denyse Tontz,
Damian Shannon and Mark Swift wrote the screenplay,
Johnson's production company, Seven Bucks Productions, is involved in the film.
Flynn is also associated with Johnson in their joint production venture, Seven Bucks Productions, for this film.
Berk's involvement is part of the collaborative efforts of Seven Bucks Productions in making this movie with Johnson.
Schwartz and Johnson, both associated with Seven Bucks Productions, are working together for the production of this film.
Bonann's participation is a part of the joint efforts by Seven Bucks Productions in association with Johnson for the creation of this movie.
In this film, Hadera is cast opposite Johnson's character.
Bass plays a supporting role in the movie as Ronnie, a disco dancer who falls in love with Parker.
Ellerbee, played by Abdul-Mateen II, is a police officer who keeps reminding Mitch that being a lifeguard gives him no actual jurisdiction on the beach.
